page.title: 03SPRINGHILL HOSTEL
page.content: There are 30 people living in the Springhill Mentally Handicapped Hostel at present.This fills it to its capacity.There are 17 men and 13 women aged between 24-64.There are 26 full time workers employed at the hostel. There is a day care unit held each day and 12 of the people from the home attend on a regular basis. Older people in the hostel spend their time knitting and sewing whilst 16 travel to a nearby adult training centre. Two residents have jobs in Leek. The residents share the day to day chores in the hostel such as drying dishes and setting the tables.Some like to help in the garden. The hostel is owned by the Council who take the residents pensions as part of their upkeep. Each resident is given seven pounds fifty pence weekly.
